website_summaries.verdict: Reliable hair removal via top-notch technology. The one to get if you want the very best.
pros: A revamped model w/a 40% wider head
Unique MicroGrip tweezer technology grips short hairs
cons: A bit pricey, but it offers top quality for the cost

customer_reviews.title: One attachment breaks and you need to send everything back. Big hassle to repair/replace!
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this product, also, and like another reviewer, the same attachment head broke after only a few uses. It is the only attachment that I would actually use, too. I called Braun and you have to send back EVERYTHING even though only one part is broken. Believe me, it is a hassle and time-consuming. At the very least I would expect them to replace just the one broken part/attachment. Very poor quality. Would never by this Brand again.
customer_reviews.author: What She Said

customer_reviews.title: Very short lived
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working by the 3rd actual use.. and the product warranty link is a fake (just brings you back to the product again). So you can't easily get it replaced, and it's longevity is garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was such a great epilator at first
customer_reviews.text: It was such a great epilator at first. I won’t lie it hurts like no other when you first start, but it gets immensely better. My skin is smoother and healthier than it was with shaving or waxing. I really love it. I bought this as an open box deal. I didn’t start using it until October and it’s just died. I’ve tried problem shoooting and I’ve searched online to figure out how to fix it. It just loses its juice and it no longer works. I’ll send it off to a Braun repair specialist but I’m mad that I’ll have to start the epilating process all over again when it comes back.
customer_reviews.author: yakimama

customer_reviews.title: Beware - can not use it while its plugged in.
customer_reviews.text: Beware - you can't use it while it's charging!!! That's a huge negative for me because besically if i forgot to charge it I can't use it. This is my 3rd epilator. I had another braun, then Phillips and with both previous ones I could use them plugged in or not. In terms of its function it is ok - just ok as I have to go over the same area 3 to 5 times to get all the hairs out so overall I can honestly say that I regret buying it especially at a cost of over $100.
customer_reviews.author: happy mom

customer_reviews.title: Worth It
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews, I was excited and absolutely terrified to use this thing. I used it on my legs after exfoliating. It didn't hurt nearly as much as I expected - my tattoos hurt worse. The massaging head doesn't get as short of hairs as the other, so I ended up using the other head and going over everything a second time. I don't know how long my hair was, I was 4 days out from shaving last. I feel like longer leg hair would sting way more. My skin is pretty sensitive, and this definitely made it mad for a bit. I followed up with aloe and after a few hours my legs were really smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Ahrens

customer_reviews.title: He saw all the great reviews it had on amazon so he bought it
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this for me as he's tired of me complaining about shaving. He saw all the great reviews it had on amazon so he bought it. I gave this product 3 stars because it just doesn't pluck hair that well. I spend about 15 to 20 mins doing one armpit trying to get most of the hair and end up shaving the rest. I love the fact that it does take longer for hair to grow and when it does it's super thin.I will admit it's painful the first few times but after awhile it doesn't hurt as much. I'm looking for powerhouse epliator unfortunately it wasn't this one.
customer_reviews.author: henry coll

customer_reviews.title: Ouch! But Wow, It Really Works!
customer_reviews.text: Holy moly. This thing is a modern torture device. I don't mind pain much at all but I was still surprised. It definitely hurts less after a warm shower. I was able to do my legs in about 5 minutes and I have very thick hair. So it's over pretty quickly. If you're going to epilate your armpits, please please please use water. You'll thank yourself. Legs and arm pits are still basically smooth five days later and I have no ingrowns. Might be black magic.
customer_reviews.author: nicole

customer_reviews.title: Damaged skin caused ingrown hairs
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to try this. I have a very HIGH pain tolerance but this was horrible! It feels like you are burning a layer of skin off. I was willing to work on that, maybe numb it or get drunk?! But a few days after i tested it on my leg, the area was solid ingrown hairs..yes,it damaged my skin to the point of regeneration and blocked my poor hairs:( maybe youll have a better time,we are all different. My experience was not good at all.
customer_reviews.author: Julian Colesberry

customer_reviews.title: Results weren't good
customer_reviews.text: I think there may be a learning curve to using this effectively. I haven't mastered it. I like the exfoliating brush. I haven't used the epilator or the razor in the shower. It didn't perform great and I didn't get the results I was expecting for the price. I don't know that it performed any better than a less expensive item. I have some coarse hairs from hormonal issues and really had high hopes for this. I wasn't impressed. It works well for the fine peach fuzz but nobody wants to wait for hair to get long enough to where this product may be more effective. I ended up returning it. I would not purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Breecham

customer_reviews.title: Effective, but has a big drawback.
customer_reviews.text: It's effective, I'll tell you that. Hurts, but considering I've been waxing for years, it wasn't as bad as I thought it would be. Feels a bit like pinching, or well, basically like plucking your own eyebrows but you're pulling out several hairs at once. Takes forever if you're a hairy girl. The biggest drawback, however, is the fact that there's no hair collecting chamber of any sort. It kind of all jams behind the rolling pincher and you have to keep cleaning it because it starts spitting hairs back at you. It's very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Marina

customer_reviews.title: PAINFUL AS F
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what kind of psychopath you have to be to use this thing and actually think it's a good idea. It is insanely painful and takes a billion times longer than waxing. Throwing it in the trash and going to the salon!!!!! Who seriously in their right mind either has no nerves in their skin or enjoys torturing themselves in what is quite possibly the most inefficient process ever invented. Wow. I'm an idiot for even thinking this could be a good idea.
customer_reviews.author: JeKo

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Like others, i bought this in covid- i wish i had got it yearsss ago! Yes its painful- but nothing u cant tolerate (threading and waxing are painful too!) Trick is- use the sensitive cap for the first time! Yes- Even on legs! And then once u understand the pattern/direction/technique- switch to the regular cap! It made tonsss of difference because i knew what to expect and how much pain to expect! I got this before prime day so i paid the full price but it was almost fifty dollars lesser on prime day. If you are a costco member- they also stock the better version from time to time! But its worth all the money!
customer_reviews.author: GJP

customer_reviews.title: Braun legacy
customer_reviews.text: Braun makes the absolute most amazing epilators! I still have my eversoft model which is probably 15 years old and works perfectly. This new model is just sooooooooo efficient and amazing with all its upgrades. I use it with no guard for precise and fast epilation. Excesize caution if you new to epilators. My only recommendation for improvement is to make an on/off switch for the light. It wastes battery power.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Got it yesterday hairless head to literally my toes today!
customer_reviews.text: Plugged it in charged it, followed the directions voila head to toe, literally, hair free! So if I wake up tomorrow or in the next few days without a million ingrown hairs, yeah, I will never shave again! I have to say that the pain most women described just wasn’t there for me! No worse than tweezing but a bigger patch in one fell swoop! I did use the low setting. So will save water, money on shave cream, so no cans in the land fill, and it was really fast!
customer_reviews.author: Island Bound

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I had never used an epilator before. I will say the first time use for the bikini area is a little tough, go with the direction the hair grows (first time and use in the shower) Just do a little at a time... now that I have used it for a month...I love it...does an awesome job. Yes sometimes you have to do over the same area twice (especially my knees!) but I had to usually with a normal razor...
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Gears broke not too long after return period was up.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this item and would have given it a 5 had it not broken just after the return window had closed. It was very efficient at pulling out hair, even very short hairs. I was amazed at how well it worked. Until it didn’t. The epilator head had some of its plastic gears break off and now although the motor works fine, it cannot spin the part with the tweezers that pull the hair out. It is of no use to me any longer.
customer_reviews.author: mrebekah

customer_reviews.title: Does not pull from the root
customer_reviews.text: Have been waxing for years and decided an epilator would be less mess and easier to use. After researching and reading countless reviews I decided to purchase this one even though it was more than I wanted to spend for something that would rip my hair out. I was very disappointed to see that this product does not rip the hair out by the root, it breaks it at the skin and causes razor burn?? Hair came back quicker and twice as thick as before using the epilator. Now I have to start over with waxing get back to the little hair I had before using this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Kind of helped, but lots of ripping
customer_reviews.text: Rather than pulling the hair out by the root, I felt like a lot of my hair was just getting torn right above the skin line, even when following tips / instructions on how hard to press and on speed. And the shaver head wasn’t great for me - I found just shaving to get a closer shave for all areas I tried. I did notice that the epilator didn’t still result in my hair growing back a little bit slower. But only by a day or two compared to using a razor and shaving (test done on one leg each).
customer_reviews.author: minamesephy

customer_reviews.title: If shaving works for you, don't be tempted by this torture device
customer_reviews.text: Worst experience I ever had with hair removal. My armpits were swollen for over a week and the hair hasn't grown back normal in over 2 months. I liked the idea of shaving less frequently, but this was so painful I would never be able to coax myself into doing it again. I intended to use it on my bikini line, but the pain it caused on my legs and armpits was so intense that I would never be able to try it in a more sensitive area. Having the hair grow back sporadically with in-grown hairs here and there made me regret the experience for over a month.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I have red hair, my body hair is blonde. This doesn't work for me, it doesn't recognize my fair hairs, only whatever thicker ones it find. Works well in thicker areas like underarms and bikini line. But it doesn't reliably remove my leg hair. Which is upsetting because that's why I bought it. I read reviews and didn't see any saying that it doesn't work on red/blonde hair. So hopefully this helps someone. I'll update if I can figure it out, maybe I'm doing it wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: ... ready to send this back because it was too painful!!
customer_reviews.text: I had the box ready to send this back because it was too painful!!!! Before I did, I gave it one more shot and tried it in the shower,,, Love it!!! When you use this in the shower, the hot water opens the pores and it doesn't hurt! I never thought I'd be using something to pull my hair out, but I love how long I can go without shaving! Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I found that using this in the shower/bathtub with body wash and or soap works best for me. In the shower, it keeps the Epilator cooler and using a body wash allowed it to glide more smoothly on my skin. The Charge last for about an hour to an hour and a half. I havent timed myself, but it last at least an hour. Chargers up in about the same amount of time. I have thick hair so I always exfoliate before I use the epilator. I have issues with ingrown hairs so I have to exfoliate a lot. Taking a warm/hot bath helps with ingrown hairs too.
customer_reviews.author: Villagepanda

customer_reviews.title: Pain is exaggerated
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing, you can use it in a chair anywhere and it leaves your legs so smooth. The pain itself is not as bad as people say at all. If you've ever dry shaved in an emergency and had that burning feeling afterwards, the one that went away in time? THIS is exactly like that without any redness. In fact, afterwards it just tingles. Totally fun to use though knowing I will have smooth legs for weeks. Best.Mothers Day.gift.ever.
customer_reviews.author: Leah G.

customer_reviews.title: Painful but effective
customer_reviews.text: Pains like hell! I have sensitive skin and corse hair on my body, so it’s very painful for me. But after killing myself for half an hour, the portion I epilate is smooth and hairless and it’s the best feeling. Remember to moisturize it after though. Its less painful if you do it while showering, but it takes more time to remove wet hair. So I do it after my bath, when the pores are open. This reduces the pain as well.
customer_reviews.author: Aditi Purohit

customer_reviews.title: Good coverage and convenient usage in the shower.
customer_reviews.text: Having detachable heads for shaving and epilating makes daily usage and cleaning really convenient. When you're too lazy or anxious, you can switch to shaving and storage is minimal with the drawstring bag. This brand catches more short hairs than the Philips I used previously, albeit at a steeper price point. The battery life is surprisingly good; after two weeks of use, the meter is still green. As other reviews mentioned, the massage and facial heads are gimmicky, but the waterproof design is superb. I purchased it with a discount applied, so the added cost for the facial brush was nonexistent.
customer_reviews.author: Person B

customer_reviews.title: Not for wimpy people
customer_reviews.text: This is my first epilator...I wasn’t quite sure of the pain. I tried it on a dry leg as soon as it arrived. It wasn’t as bad as I thought but it wasn’t good either. It sort of feels like little electric shocks instead of a hair pulling sensation. After a little while it got easier...I was able to do complete passes instead of short strokes. Using this on your underarm is WAY worst. I think I’ll use regular razors for that. Overall this is a good quality product. Does the job but it definitely is not for someone with a low pain tolerance.
customer_reviews.author: lavendar0985

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: I get a Brazilian wax done regularly and was hoping this would save me some money. Wrong. I have to go over the same area 15-25 times. No joke. I might as well use a regular tweezers. Ive tried wet and dry. Ive tried other areas on the body. Ive tried with different lengths of hair. Didn't matter. It just doesn't work. Period. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: If you have epilated before...this is great!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an epilady from woot about 3 years ago and I have used it since. I decided it was time for an upgrade. This thing is GREAT and a huge improvement from the epilady. Epilating takes some time to get used to because it is painful, but once you have done it a few times and you know what to expect it becomes much more tolerable. Think of the first time you had your eyebrows waxed...hurts a lot. But once you've done it several times, you know what is coming and it hurts less because you are prepared.
customer_reviews.author: Moore Family

customer_reviews.title: Does't work after a couple of weeks.
customer_reviews.text: This product doesn't work. I've been using it for over 2 months and it doesnt grab majority of the hairs even the long ones. I thought it was working the first couple of weeks but now it's not working. I dont know if the machine is losing its power or what but it no longer grabs the hair. I wouldn't recommend this product to friends. I'm disappointed in the return window being only a month, especially considering you need to use an epilator for several weeks before you know whether or not its working.
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: Poor customer service!
customer_reviews.text: The first few uses are a little uncomfortable but I believe that your body becomes desensitized a little as it improves with time. I have now had this just over a year. A couple of months ago it started leaving scratch marks on my lower legs. Now the battery is down to lasting only 5 minutes if I’m lucky. Initially a full charge would last a week. I contacted customer services regarding the 2 issues above. The scratches they will send to the research team. The battery issue they will let me take “advantage” of the inconvenience of mailing it back, being without the product, and the bonus; I get to pay for it all!
customer_reviews.author: Lou1109

customer_reviews.title: Works Exactly as Designed
customer_reviews.text: I had an older model that worked well; this one is better (easier on the skin). I see a lot of people complain of pain from using. The first couple of times, yes, it is painful. Keep using it, it will become uncomfortable. Keep using it and it will become like a good back scratching for your legs. It really will stop hurting after a few uses! This is SO much better than shaving. I have thick dark hair and only have to do this every couple of weeks on my legs and less frequently under my arms and no shadow in between epilatings. Last benefit, when grows back there is less of it and is much finer.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: The best torture device ever!
customer_reviews.text: Is it uncomfortable? Yes, at first but you will get used to it the more you use it. LOVE LOVE LOVE not having to shave my legs everyday! No pain no gain! I use it without any attachment cover for the closest smoothest legs. The face brush that came with it, blah, useless.
customer_reviews.author: Jobeth Stanfill

customer_reviews.title: OUCH!
customer_reviews.text: I have both legs tattooed from feet to pelvic bone and 7 hour sessions under the needle without pain relief hurt less. I tap out on this after half an hour and that is with medical grade ibuprofen + benzos and soapy warm water. WOW painful. Pros: - pulls out hair as advertised - charge holds Cons: - pain 100/10 - requires pain medication for use (medical grade ibuprofen) - difficult to clean - hair grows back same after multiple uses - all of the ingrown hairs :( - eventually I accepted defeat
customer_reviews.author: Genevieve

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely LOVE this!!
customer_reviews.text: For anyone who remembers the Epil-Lady with that horrible vibrating spring that ripped hair out of your body, don't be afraid of this. It's a whole new device, with a very comfortable way of getting rid of hair. I've used it on several sensitive areas of my body and while it's not unnoticeable, if you hate shaving or get a shaving rash, this might be a good solution for you. I absolutely love it! Because it takes the hair out from the root, you don't have to use it every day, and over time the hair grows back thinner and there is less hair. I'm so glad I found this!
customer_reviews.author: Write4Change

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase in 2019
customer_reviews.text: I love it. This is the first epilator I bought and used and I am really happy with it. I wasn't sure if I would like it but my legs stay soft for at least a 1,5 weeks. The new hairs that grow are really soft and tiny and not as stiff and ugly looking as they were when I used to shave. So I am really happy with my purchase and I recommend it to everybody who is lazy like me ;) Big plus: You can use it on the sofa!!
customer_reviews.author: Sophie Franz-Badur

customer_reviews.title: But the light does help see the hairs you're trying to get if you like to shave while in the shower
customer_reviews.text: I wish I bought one of these when I first started shaving, it would have saved me a lot of time and money! I prefer to use it outside of the shower, I tried using it while wet and it just wasn't working for me. But the light does help see the hairs you're trying to get if you like to shave while in the shower. When you first use it, yes it'll hurt a bit but you'll get used to it. I use it under my arms and it doesn't even bother me now. The only place I can't use it is my bikini area because it's just too sensitive.
customer_reviews.author: Tori

customer_reviews.title: Thank You
customer_reviews.text: It's a little jarring at first. However, once you get used to that; it's completely worth the money! It's a time saver. I'm not exactly sure why they list Moisturizing as one of the features because I haven't found anything that would do that. The light is bright; but sometimes the way you are positioning it, keeps you from seeing. I would give it more stars for "easy to use" but I want people to know that you don't really just take it out the box and use it...For me, it took a little practice. Overall, this is a great product! It arrived promptly as well. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Tina Korotky

customer_reviews.title: Painful but effective!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to start epilating to reduce how often I needed to shave and the number of razor blades to purchase. The process, a couple months in, is still very painful! I can tolerate it but it still hurts a lot. The device itself, though, works very well. The epilation and electric shaver do a good job and the battery life is great as long as you charge it fully.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as online reviews
customer_reviews.text: I read so many online reviews that spouted praise after praise, so I purchased it expecting a great product and was disappointed. I wonder if the praises were bought? But the Braun epilator cut my neck. Also it left hairs either broken off instead of plucked or it missed them completely and I had to go back and forth several times — eventually I would shave some spots. I have coarse hair, so no excuse. I returned.
customer_reviews.author: Sean W.

customer_reviews.title: Wish I started sooner!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. It hurt SO BAD the first time, but after the initial deforestation, dealing with regrowth is pretty much painless. It's so easy to use, battery lasts a long time, and I am really happy with my purchase. The attachments are great as well, but I find the smooth wide on the most used and versatile. The exfoliator is just an extra to me, I don't care for it too much. I do use it, but don't notice any difference in my skin texture.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: so the first time really pulls a lot of even very fine hair out
customer_reviews.text: Surprised at how well it works, so the first time really pulls a lot of even very fine hair out. Once that is done, a touch-up every few days is all you need, less than shaving everyday to get the same results. The two spds is nice, the attachments and covers are handy to have. Lots of power, you have to be careful using it without pulling the skin tight, some areas can get pinched. Easy to use, quick once the initial use is done. Lets you know when to recharge and it does that quickly enough.
customer_reviews.author: Abda

customer_reviews.title: Cannot get Replacement brushes for the Facial Cleansing Brush
customer_reviews.text: I just got the product today and found out it is a discontinued model. While you can get replacement parts for the Silk-epil 9, the cleansing brush model is so old Braun no longer makes replacement brushes for the facial cleansing brush. That information should have been in the description. Not impressed with this seller at all.
customer_reviews.author: cg

customer_reviews.title: Great Dry epilator
customer_reviews.text: The first couple times using this product was painful and it left little red bumps everywhere. After the 3rd time using it I felt as if I had been de-sensitized to the pain. It still is an annoying sensation but if you pull the skin back or rub the next area with your hand first it won't be as bad. I did feel like the product did not work as well in the shower (took longer, less precise) so I prefer to use it as a dry epilator.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It is really easy to use, if you are get used to the pain, if not would hurts. Work really good, battery life is long enough for 3 or 4 short sessions or a really long one (full body) and a little more. The only reason that I give it 4 starts is because it does not adapt well to very sunken body shapes such as knees or part of the armpits, so it still do it's job.
customer_reviews.author: Valeria

customer_reviews.title: So smooth!
customer_reviews.text: I've been working up the courage to get one for a while. The first time really hurt and my skin looked really angry. It only took a few days for the depilating process to become less painful. Now it barely feels like anything, and the result is.. Wow! My legs have never been this smooth and I can finally wear tank tops without the fear of embarassing myself by flashing those razor bumps at unsuspecting bystanders. Totally worth it. It came with a facial brush that I was skeptical about at first. And now I like it. Gets a lot more yuck off my face than without.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Larina

customer_reviews.title: Wish I'd Tried This Sooner
customer_reviews.text: I was so hesitant about purchasing an epilator, it seemed like a good idea but I was worried it would be too painful. And it's not painless, but I think the pain is minimal--just quick little pings--similar to tweezing eyebrows, which I've done since I was in middle school! I especially like the purple guard that makes it gentler on more sensitive areas like underarms. I haven't braved trying this my bikini line--and may never. But for legs and underarms this is the bomb.
customer_reviews.author: Adele in CBus

customer_reviews.title: It super hurt and didnt work for me
customer_reviews.text: Well...I was so super excited then just disappointed. I tried everything. Of course it hurt but Im sure I would have sucked it up if it actually worked. It just kept pulling my hair but not actually getting the hair out so I would have to keep going overthe area over and over again!! No cool. It hurt...a lot. I tried several different methods and nothing worked. Everyone elsed reviews were awesome but this producted jst didnt work for me. I ended up giving up and sending it back....but glad i tried it.
customer_reviews.author: Adorkable Mama

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I was bouncing back and forth between this model and the epil 7, and my husband told me to just get it. So I did. If you're even considering this model, get it. $100 seems like a lot of money, but after one use, I knew it was the best purchase I've made. Some people say it hurts, and I suppose it kind of does. I categorize it more as annoying than painful. If you've ever waxed, you won't have a problem. If you're worried or have a low pain tolerance, get some roll-on Aspercreme with 2% lidocaine (not benzocaine, it's not as strong). It dries quickly and doesn't interfere with the grabbiness of the tweezers.
customer_reviews.author: Keiva

customer_reviews.title: Will not work while plugged in, battery only
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to use especially love the light, making it easier to see what I was doing. Yes it hurts, but was expecting this and pain decreases with each use. I was disapointed that it will not work while using the cord, but have not run out of battery while using it either.
customer_reviews.author: Lynnette L Arntson

customer_reviews.title: Didn't love it
customer_reviews.text: This was my first epilator use and I didn't love it. I was hoping for something that would allow me to cut down on the amount of times I have to shave. The process is painful (which I was expecting) and you have to make quite a few passes to really get all the hairs. I used it on my lower legs, and I feel like after using it, the hair follicles look really big and make my legs look much less smooth. I stopped using it and they still look that way. It wasn't cheap, so I'm not happy that I purchased this product.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting battery
customer_reviews.text: I have purchases several epilators over the years and inevitably the battery goes bad gears go bad. I have used this regularly and it seems to be ok. The battery lasts forever between charges. I only really use it to epilate and I use the low setting. The higher setting seems to break hair rather than pull. The other half has used the razor head and it works for a quick male face shave. It came with a face brush cleanser which I have not used but it looks and feels just like any other I have had so I am sure it works just as well.
customer_reviews.author: Yoshiko Ichikura

customer_reviews.title: First Epilator
customer_reviews.text: This is my first epilator ever so I have nothing to compare to. I found it works nicely on the “softer” areas like underarms, face, and bikini line. Did NOT work well on my legs. Misses so many hairs no matter how many times I go over it or switch directions and speed. Nice thing about an epilator in general: when your hair does grow back in, it’s much softer and you don’t have any “prickly” hair (especially nice for bikini line!) On the pain, the first couple times, it feels like you are peeling your skin off... but if you get through it, it’s worth it for the benefits. Put lotion on afterwards to sooth. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fabulous. I was hesitant to spend the money, but I am so glad I did. Yes, it can be uncomfortable, depending on where you use it. There are some areas that I still prefer to shave, but I love this for my legs and facial hair. Like so many older women facial hair is an ongoing annoyance. This device helps me keep my chin and neck clear at all times. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Diane K. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Totally Surprised!!
customer_reviews.text: I was leery when I bought it, as i have used ancient epilators in the past. To my complete surprise, this is for sure the best $ I've spent in years. Completely painless on my legs, very few bumps, which all cleared by the morning. I cant have any laser procedures due to tattoos on my legs, this is an incredible purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Chani1074

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: I followed all the suggestions on how to keep from developing ingrown hairs. But this device tore my legs up BAD. It took weeks to get them back to normal. I could see the hair growing under my skin and I had to assist with digging it out from under my skin. The trimmer works great, but that's a lot of money for just a trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: It truly is a miracle
customer_reviews.text: I have struggled with facial hair my entire life. I am 50 and have tried everything. It has been my worst nightmare as I resorted to shaving and the hair was growing back thicker at my jaw line and neck area. I bought this epilator 6 weeks ago and I literally have no hair growth in my problem areas. I still touch my face and neck 100 times a ago still not believing it's gone. I would recommend this to any women experiencing any type of excess hair growth problems.
customer_reviews.author: K. N

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I was very hesitant to buy an epilator due to reading bad reviews and horror stories. However, after some encouragement from a close friend I bit the bullet and bought one and I’m so glad I did! It’s so easy to use! And although some people say it’s painful it’s not that bad - or at least not as bad as waxing from someone who gets Brazilian waxed every month. My legs are smoother than ever and I it’s been over a week since use and the hair is only now slowly starting to grow back! Awesome product! Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mazikyn

customer_reviews.title: Removed almost NO hair
customer_reviews.text: After fully charging it, I followed Braun's instructions on their website for how to best use the Silk Epil 9, and after 5 minutes of trying every direction, every pressure, and every speed I could think of, the test patch on the back of my hand barely had 1/3 of the hair removed. How this was rated the best Epilator of 2019 is utterly beyond me. It did practically NOTHING.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I have sensitive skin and shaving always irritates my skin. But this is great I don’t itch I don’t get bumps it’s great. The pain isn’t to bad like at first u may be like woah no way but push threw and u get use to it and the fact that it last so long it’s great well worth the price. The light is a great idea. The shaver thing is nice cause I’m still not able to do bikini area or pits so shaving it is nice and not so irritating on my skin.
customer_reviews.author: KelseyKens

customer_reviews.title: When I open the box I found a pubic hair all over this product
customer_reviews.text: This is probably one of the most disgusting things I’ve ever seen and bought from Amazon. as I open the box it look like it was used, as soon as I pop the epil out someone’s pubic hairs or whatever it was came out as you see in the picture. This is by far the most disgusting thing I’ve ever seen in my life. Hopefully I can get my money back and I hope that everybody checks their products before they use them.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT epilate well at all.
customer_reviews.text: Bought based on ratings by consumer info on the net. Not impressed at all. I dont recommend because it doesnt epilate well on first or second run over area, always leaves shorter hair behind. Very disappointed and several other brands I've purchase thru the years are 10 times better. I dont even waste my time using this one. I use my 3 year old, different brand and at 3 years old it out performs this product.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Not as effective as expected
customer_reviews.text: I may have put too high expectations on this product but for the price, I believed it would be more effective. It does not remove hair consistently even with multiple passes. The battery lasts and the design is easy to change heads.
customer_reviews.author: CStewart

customer_reviews.title: By far this is the BEST epilator I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: By far this is the BEST epilator I have ever used. I am not being paid to write this review! First, I won't comment on pain because everyone's tolerance for pain is different. However, I will say after epilating for a few years my hair growth has reduced and gotten finer in some places. So the pain or discomfort of epilation does reduce over time. This product is amazing. I love the different heads. My old epilator was no longer getting all the hairs in my armpits. This epilator got every single one! Pros: Light Different heads Easy to use and switch the heads for multi-year Wet/dry usage Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Stef

customer_reviews.title: Hair today, gone tomorrow...
customer_reviews.text: After doing quite a bit of research, I found that this epilator is the best. It replaced one that I had. This one, however, can be used both wet and dry. The price was very good, too. I highly recommend it. It works very well! Also, it comes with a number of attachments, that although I have no need of them, may be an asset for another buyer.
customer_reviews.author: Willie B

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Wow does using this hurt. However it works perfectly. I would suggest new comers use it in the shower or under running warm water as it helps with the irritation and pain. Over time hair growth appears to become lighter and more far in-between so using it more often become less. Also the more it is used over the area your skin gets use to the pulling. It almost becomes massaging when used frequently. I would avoid the face and any area that is super sensitive.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin D'Amour

customer_reviews.title: I love my new epilator!
customer_reviews.text: I love my new epilator. I won’t lie it did hurt some but nothing that I couldn’t handle just had to take some very short strokes. Now my legs are the absolute smoothest they have ever been! I can’t stop touching them! What a difference over shaving and the results are supposed to last longer too. I love this thing. Can’t wait to show off my legs!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, long lasting results!
customer_reviews.text: Love this epilator! I love that it only takes a few minutes and doesn't hurt as bad as getting waxed and you get the same results. I find I don't have to use it again for 1-2 weeks! But i've also been using this for a while now. The only down side is I can't do my Bikini or underarm, it's just far to painful, i'd say waxing is less painful in these areas. Bummed about that but, maybe one day they're refine it to be gentler in those sensitive areas.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: more thorough than my previous [brand name redacted] depilator
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used all the features yet (in the shower, or the 'face brush') but based on what I have used, I like this and would buy it again. The plus: this depilator removes nearly all of the hair in its path--my previous one took two or three passes, even when it was new. The amusing: it's got a 'headlight', a small light that's positioned to shine on the section of arm/leg that you're about to work on.
customer_reviews.author: Josephine Henke

customer_reviews.title: much better than my old one .
customer_reviews.text: I got a new epilator a long time ago and wow what a difference to this awesome upgrade. My old one left so much more hair behind and hurt just as much so I feel like for the same pain Im left with less hair and im not getting the ingrown as bad with this one either. can I say I love being able to use it in the shower
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Specht

customer_reviews.title: Any epilator I use usually gears towards epilating my face but this one really did not do a good job. I like the light it has but ...
customer_reviews.text: Cannot seem to understand why this product is four stars. Any epilator I use usually gears towards epilating my face but this one really did not do a good job. I like the light it has but the actual times I tried to epilate, it would miss every single hair and break them off. People here seem to claim that it is much less painful than other epilators but I personally did not notice it. I've used cheaper epilators than this one who have given me much better results. Not my favorite product :l
customer_reviews.author: susieq984

customer_reviews.title: Epilating not as painful as I remember...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if it's the epilator, but epilating is a lot less painful than I remember this time around. (I also wax, so my follicles may have become desensitized over the years too.) The epilator has two speeds. In all honesty, I prefer the 2nd setting (the faster setting) because epilating is going to hurt a little regardless, so you may as well get it done faster! This kit comes with several extras - I have only used the epilator so far, and it works pretty great.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this epilator
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this epilator. It is not nearly as painful as some of the reviews would lead you to believe. In fact, I would say it was really only the first touch to my skin that hurt. After that, it wasn't any different than shaving. I used it a week ago for the first time and there is no re-growth yet. I just used it on my upper lip today. Again - it wasn't that painful. So far, there is no irritation, so I'm hopeful. The unit is high quality and simple to use. I'm very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Girl

customer_reviews.title: Still Smooth after a week and counting
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this product only once so far so this is a fresh newbie review and I love it! I can see why most may respond negatively to the pain. It does have a plucking sensation however I have a high pain threshold so it was bareable. *Also be sure to use the right attachments for certain areas!* (It’ll limit unecessary pain) Let me say though I haven’t had to shave in so far a week and I’m still SMOOTH! Def a keeper. It’s practically magic!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too painful to use
customer_reviews.text: This is the most painful thing ever. It feels like it's catching your skin instead of the hair. I tried to do my underarms in the morning, and more than twelve hours later they still hurt enough to distract me, even after soothing lotion. I've had laser hair removal and been waxed, and this thing is more painful than the two combined. I would rather tweeze every single hair on my body one at a time than use this thing again.
customer_reviews.author: Kyra

customer_reviews.title: Does not last long
customer_reviews.text: My old Braun Epilator still works after 20 years of use. The only reason I bought a new one was because I needed a different plug and was tired of using an adapter. Well, this one died suddenly after 18 months. I guess, quality of Braun epilators declined and one should not expect them to last.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy S

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it hurts but to get around that just get your legs waxed one time then use epilator weekly for maintenance. Then it only hurts a tiny bit which is easily negated by pulling the skin taut. After using it a couple weeks it doesn’t hurt much at all. I love this thing so much. My skin was drying out horribly from shaving. Now, problem solved. I enjoy smooth skin all the time now. I’m SO glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: prevkasamy

customer_reviews.title: Idk why I didn't buy this sooner!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for about 2 weeks now and I love it. I won't lie....the first time it hurts LIKE HELL! But it works. And the second time it was way less painful. It still hurts, I mean it's ripping the hair out of your skin. But after he first time of use, I didn't have to shave my legs for 8 days, and even then it was little stubble. This is the best investment I have made in terms of shaving. Hands down. I used it on my armpits as well. AMAZING results.
customer_reviews.author: Cole7616

customer_reviews.title: Strong, but my older one was less painful
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what it is, but everytime I use this, it's so strong that my skin always bleeds. By last epilator that I bought years ago and used till it died was not as effective (I had to go back and forth a few times) at removing hair right away, but it never made me bleed. But then again, It does't take very long for me to be completely hairless with one swipe on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Painful
customer_reviews.text: Painful and does not get any less painful with use. Device is too large to get hair above lip. Directions that come with the device are a joke. I'll be returning the device. I wonder what they do with the returned devices?
customer_reviews.author: Daysgobydsr

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I do not think that this hurts as bad as other reviewers have said. I am used to tattoo pain and the feeling of tweezing hairs. I was really nervous to try it because of those reviews, but the pain was nothing at all. It works a lot better when you go slower over your legs instead of faster. Good results! Now to see if the hairs really stay gone longer than shaving..
customer_reviews.author: kenny

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work as described
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I missed the time window to return this item. It was bought to replace an electric shaver/epilater that lasted for many years. I paid the higher price for this unit because of the brand and was hoping for a quality unit as I previously had from Braun. This unit apppears to have a wide application area but in fact only the very center touches the skin and does not remove facial hair. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Mc

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this. I had an epilator about 15 years ago and it was so painful that it was barely used. I decided to try it again and this one is so much better! It still hurts but after about 5 minutes, I barely could feel it anymore as I became used to it. I only used it on my legs.
customer_reviews.author: I. Brant

customer_reviews.title: Worth the pain
customer_reviews.text: This thing will be your best friend and your worst enemy. I bought this because I have thick, coarse leg hair and I was tired of getting ingrown hairs and bumps and needing to shave again after 2 days. I have only used it twice, but I love the results. Now—it freaking HURTS!! And I consider myself to have a high pain tolerance. I recommend soaking in the tub for at least 10 minutes before you start and use short strokes. The smoothness lasts days longer than shaving and the hair grows back thinner. It also stays charged for multiple uses, is easy to clean, and the light is great.
customer_reviews.author: Emily A Smith

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: Very DISAPPOINTED with the Braun Silk-epil 9-579! I spent time researching different brands and reading reviews. The shaver head will give me smoother legs. I've watched videos to make sure I am using correctly. LEGS ARE NOT SMOOTH. Instead of a clean removal it breaks the hairs off close to the skin or misses the hair completely! Don't waste your money. Skip this one. Unfortunately for I waited to long to send back for a full refund. This should get 0 out of 5!!!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Brown

customer_reviews.title: I have wasted quite a bit of money trying to find an ...
customer_reviews.text: Finally! I have wasted quite a bit of money trying to find an epilator that really removes facial hair. Have tried several different brands, from expensive to inexpensive...none of them worked at all well. Decided to try once more and have been extremely pleased with the Braun epilator. It really does work! I don't use it for any but facial hair and it's terrific!
customer_reviews.author: Jaykay

customer_reviews.title: Best ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing I ever bought. I usually go for cheaper one, just to end up having to replace them every 2 years or so. None of them had worked as well as this one, and from other reviews it looks like it will last years. This guy holds the charge and does an amazing job. Worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Gabstronaut

customer_reviews.title: So happy!
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy to find this product. Tried many different brands before and let me tell you, they all were really painful. My last machine broke so I wanted to try something new. When I tried my Braun silk epil for the first time, I got myself ready for pain. I won't tell that it totally painless but definitely about 80% less pain than with other brands. I definitely will recommend this machine to all my family and friends! Forgot to mention that it does the job, it leaves my skin very smooth and no hair.
customer_reviews.author: likeafeather

customer_reviews.title: To the ladies out there who say this is painless ...
customer_reviews.text: To the ladies out there who say this is painless - you couldn't be more wrong. HOWEVER once you've set your mind to getting all of these hairs pulled out, this tool works fabulously. I have legendary leg hair - when I want to wear anything other than full-length pants, I'm doing a full shave at least every other day. After using this epilator, I went a full TWO WEEKS until I saw any returning growth, and it's still slow to come back. That's slower than the last time I waxed. I'm totally sold on epilators forever, I think.
customer_reviews.author: Katy Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Really love it. I have used it for years.
customer_reviews.text: I am basing this review on my old one that I have had for years. I do love it. It charges quickly. Pulls out fine little hairs. The more you use it the easier it is. With the different hair growth cycles it gets better; clearly the first few times are somewhat painful but keep going. I haven't used the shaver head only the epilator. I did use it for my under arms one, but that was too painful to try again.
customer_reviews.author: Miss. D.

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I have had epilady's for a long time and this one is by far the worst you can get. The brush and the light are whistles that you don't need and the product that you need which is the actual epilady does not get the hairs. It seems to cut the hairs that it can get, as opposed to pull them. Not good. I'va had this one for years and it's very, very good. Just thought I would try something new: Emjoi AP99 Optima Epilator. Good luck
customer_reviews.author: Maria F. Rueda

customer_reviews.title: I love my braun epilator!!
customer_reviews.text: I love mine! If you have never used an epilator I suggest buying a super cheap one to make sure you like it. I have a high pain tolerance so I don't think they hurt at all but have several friends who hate them. This is the 3rd epilator that I've had and hands down my favorite! Most of the time I take the guard off completely especially on my underarms. I tell everyone to try it they are soooo much better than shaving!
customer_reviews.author: Chissel

customer_reviews.title: No more razors! Good BYE!
customer_reviews.text: The first time you use it, it's going to suck. Really, really suck. But the end result is so worth it. I run it over my legs every few days or so and I barely feel a thing. The built-in light really makes it easy to see those tiny, fine hairs. I haven't used it in the shower, but using it right after makes it the most painless, at least for me. It's worth the price of being free from non- stop itchy shaving for the rest of my life!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally something to handle my 'hairy problem'
customer_reviews.text: I'm of German decent which in the female world translates to "shave daily or wear pants and long sleeves". I decided to give epilation a try after a coworker bought the same model and wouldn't stop raving about it. I've dealt with stubble within hours for my entire adult life, and this is the first thing I've come across that is not only sustainable, cost effective but actually also solves my problems. I'd recommend this to anyone, and have already told MANY of my friends! Give it a shot. You won't regret it (except for maybe the first couple times in which you'll cry a bit from the pain...it gets better, promise)
customer_reviews.author: KKimmick

customer_reviews.title: Best working torture device does what it should though
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using an epilator, but this one is definitely a good one. It's pretty easy to use although it does take a while to get your legs done. It really is a mini torture device but the results are amazing. Way better than shaving every other day or having to find a place to get waxed or sugared.
customer_reviews.author: Ad

customer_reviews.title: 4 Times, no change, sent back
customer_reviews.text: I NEVER give a bad review but I feel I need to on this product. Read directions very carefully and used the product. Was like I did not even do anything when I was done. I did feel the "pulling" that people talk about but it did not remove my hair. Tried 2 more times. Had my husband read the directions just to be sure I did not miss anything. After trying this 4 times and no hair gone, I sent it back. I am very disappointed. I really wanted this to work.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Ouch. It works! The epilator is effective, ...
customer_reviews.text: Ouch. It works! The epilator is effective, but wow, prepare yourself. The shaver should not be used in *very* intimate female areas .... I cut myself in a very delicate place not realizing that could happen from the trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Get it
customer_reviews.text: Not going to lie the Armpits area hurt Really really bad!! But you’ll forget all the pain when you don’t have to shave for 3months! My legs on the other hand have a faster growth rate it’s like every 4 week, but still the time you shave it 100% worth it
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: I also didn't like how i had to wait for hair to grow ...
customer_reviews.text: It does its job, but very painfully. I have since moved on to the laser treatment from braun. Much less pain, faster results, and longer lasting results. I also didn't like how i had to wait for hair to grow out before I could use this product again. However, it works as intended! I still use the body brush they included to help exfoliate my arms and legs.
customer_reviews.author: B. Cutchins

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I loved this item until the cap broke and now doesn't work properly. Can't find a replacement for this specific item. Considering the cost, the item shouldn't have broken as easily as it did. With that being said...... I still recommend it because it works really well and maybe I just got one with a flimsy cap.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Nestor

customer_reviews.title: I'm so glad I discovered epilation (but exfoliate HEAVILY
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh!!! I'm so glad I discovered epilation (but exfoliate HEAVILY, girls. Like, I pumice my legs now...haha). This thing is amazing, and fairly low pain compared to other epilators I've used. (if it's near your period use numbing spray or just skip for a bit) Totally worth the pain, though. And you definitely want to use the high setting for coarser hairs and the low setting for fine hairs.
customer_reviews.author: Metal mel

product_meta.title: Braun Epilator for Women, Silk-epil 9 9-579 Hair Removal for Women, Facial Cleansing Brush, Womens Shaver, Wet & Dry, Cordless and 7 extras
product_meta.description:
Style:SE 9-579Silk-épil 9 wet and dry epilator for women bonus edition with facial cleansing brush - fastest and most precise epilation plus cleanses face up to 6x better than manual. A shaver head and trimmer cap are included to convert your epilator for women into a full-fledged electric shaver for depilation. 12V adapter.

BRAND STORY
By Braun
feature_bullets: The 40% wider epilation head removes more hair in one stroke* for up to 4 weeks of smooth skin. Vs other Braun epilators
Braun most innovative Micro grip tweezer technology with wider, longer and deeper tweezers removes, with precision, hair 4x shorter than wax does.
Wet and dry usage in the bath or shower for a more comfortable epilation. Virtually painless with regular use.
Comes with 7 extras including a shaver head, a trimmer cap, a high frequency massage cap, a skin contact cap, a charging stand for an always charged device and a bonus facial brush

Bonus Braun Facial brush removes makeup and pore-deep impurities – 6x better than manual cleansing – in addition to refining and exfoliating skin with micro-oscillations. 100% waterproof for comfortable use in the shower.
